Letterhead                                             Pearlman
36 WARWICK ROAD                     GREAT NECK, N..Y.

                                                          Dec. 27. 1954

Dear Jack and Libby,

    Great Neck's not so far -- and full of good people -- only 30 odd minutes from Penn Station.
    So when you come we'll pitch a ball just the same.
                                                                    My best,
                                                                         Leroy
Completed

Photo of two children: Boy in footed pajamas and girl in nightgown. Both are laughing. Sign behind them reads: SEASONS GREETINGS The PEARLMANS
Shelves behind them with toy train and telephone. Curtained window. Geometric wallpaper and pegboard.
Completed

Pearson Norman Holmes
16 April
Dear Jack,

  Maclead sent along a xerox of a clipping of your photograph in yr library. Delighted of course that you're working on your autobiography.
  This goes just as a souvenir of Maclead; but how good it would be if you actually could come.
  Yrs.
   Norman (Holmes Pearson)

as of [yob?]
Completed

UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI
                                                                          COLUMBIA 

COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                                         28 March 1954

    DEPARTMENT OF ENGLISH
                                                         

Dear Conroy,

    It was good of you to send me a copy of "Midland Humor;" I think you have done an excellent job with this and I am delighted to have an inscribed copy of a good book which has given me a great deal of pleasure. The next time I go fishing at Sugar Creek I will drink an extra -- one for Jack Conroy Nelson has told me some wonderful stories about you, and I hope we can get together some time. If you come back to Moberly this summer do try to make it to Columbia, too, and have dinner and a drink or two with us. I promise, N.A. to the contrary notwithstanding, not to serve you possum pie.
   I had forgotten or had not known (altho I am a long-time admirer of "The Disinherited" and of Conroy) that you went to school here. Next year we'll have to try to have you down here for Journalism Week.
    Again, many thanks for your letter and book (and, of course, those god-awful tracts). I hope very much you make it here this summer.
   All best wishes,
                             Bill Peden
Completed

Peden, Bill

Logo                                                                                             College of Arts and Science
UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI-COLUMBIA                             ,,,,,,,,,Department of English

                                                                                                                   231 Arts & Science
                                                                                                         Columbia, Missouri 65211
                                                                                                         Telephone (314) 882-6066
                    19 Jan 85

Dear Jack,

    Sorry to hear you're in hospital. Your friends Alan Stein & Dan Levin came to the house for a visit on their way to Kansas City, & we toasted you; Alan with scotch whiskey, Dan with orange juice, & I with a drop of bourbon. 
    Good luck & good health to you, Jack; hang on in there! 
          With affection & admiration
           Bill & Petch Peden

an equal opportunity institution
Completed

The
Missouri
Review                        8 Oct 1985
Hi, Jack;

    God bless. . . & all good wishes from your Boone County aces!
                                            Bill & Petch Peden
Completed

MEMO from the editor's desk . . .               Peery, Dave

                                                                                        Oct 20

__________________________________________________________

                                       Name

Jack,

    I'm closing the sale of my house on 209 S 5th Sunday, Oct 27, and will try to stop by after all that business is finished -- I haven't been in Moberly since May.
    Stop by The right to Truth office at 207 W. Reed. They are helping to fight this right to work law.
                                            Scoop.
                        Midwest Labor Press Association

                                       [Union Logo]
Completed

Peevy
c/o Camp Thunderbird
Cairo, MO

Mr. Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Ave
Moberly Mo.

1967
Completed

Dear Jack,                                                        Sunday June 30
I am the fellow who lives where we had the party after your talk to the Folk U. Club last Spring in Columbia.

  We would like to invite you as a guest to our Friends of Folk Music Concert to be held Sat. July 6 in Columbia. This organization is affiliated with the Folk Univ. Club. Verle and the others will be there, and we plan a good party after the concert. I will be in Moberly Saturday afternoon and can pick you up. 
                                                                                                                      Dave Peery
Completed

Mar 19

Dear Jack,

    We've got so tied up in things here that I haven't got to go to Moberly yet. The evicted renters on Union (my slum) are threatening legal action about something -- so I may have to return. I'll bring a bundle of papers.
    We are looking forward to having you here. I may be in Mtn. View with my camping class that weekend but am not sure yet.
    Hope you like the review. We are busy here. I am in a play "Pillars of Salt." Wish it was on when you come so you could see it. Maybe I can get a script for you.
   Enclosed is the Buchwald Column. 
    I hope the tide swings against Nixon. Tides flowing hard against him, but the bastard can swim against the tide like a Gar drawing of a Gar.
                                                                                                                          Scoop
Completed

Peery, Dave

Organized Labor is the Bulwark of Democracy
THE KANSAS CITY
LABOR BEACON
1015 Central                            Kansas City, Missouri 64105                  221-5660

                                                                                                      Feb. 27 (1975)

Jack & Gladys & Jerry

    My job is working out fine -- as well or better than expected. Laboring people are much better to deal with than business people -- even AFL Business Reps.
   Foolkiller is fine. Park College (now bought out by Graceland) can nevertheless afford you for a last harrah. Will be looking forward to seeing you in Kansas City. The $200 is assured, according to Virgil
    I hope to be up at Moberly around March 8. Meanwhile, y'all take care.
                                                              Scoop

Enc: Various clippings.                P.S. Newspaper is? but I've got a motion on the flood for the paper to either be regular or close down.
The ONLY Newspaper Officially Endorsed by the Central Labor Councils, AFL-CIO, of Kansas City Mo. and Kansas City, Kansas, and their affiliated Unions in the Greater Kansas City Area.
Completed

Jack                                                                 Dec 28--

                                                                        Peery, Dave
                                                                         [1977]

   We were glad to see you -  I rented the apt. to Jay Johnson, a new reporter at "The Paper" who formally worked here at the Labor Beacon.
    Enclosed is the article about more faces falling at the Star.
    Happy New Year.
               Scoop.
Completed

Peery, Dave
                                                                                                   [1977]

Dear Jack,

   Rory Ellinger called me & wants to buy a house in this neighborhood.
   We both enjoyed your review in The Sunday Star on Richard Wright.
   We are quite busy at Foolkiller. We are trying to get our new building in order but are called away a lot by various groups  "to" marked  out who offer as $ to perform. We need both workers & money. Our target date for moving in the new building is July 1. We've already given notice on our present building to vacate.
   I met Julian Rayford by surprise at the Union Industries Show. He is in town & is sponsored in part by The Unitarian Church -- I heard him give his chants this morning at church. He is as good as ever & the group enjoys his entertainment
Completed

Julin stopped by the Foolkiller Friday night for a visit. I plan to see him next Wednesday.
   I'll see you next Saturday, the 22nd, while in Moberly -- will come in in the afternoon -- 
                             Until then ---
                                                    regards
                                                Scoop.
Completed

Jack -- a friend of mine who used to live in Corvallis sent me this
U. S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY
Research Triangle Park, North Carolina 27711
____________________________________________________
____________________________________________________
12/13/79              I'm going to Portland for Christmas     Scoop
Dave:

    The wife of an EPA friend in Corvallis has started an in-house newsletter at the Gazette-Times, and he sent me this copy. Thought you would be interested in the lead story. It's a small world.
   There's not much new here. We've settled in quite well, but still miss the Northwest.
   Hope the new decade will be a good one for you.
                                     Chris
Completed

Hi Jack & Gladys

   Was a rainy weekend. John Crawford is back east on a visit & said he is sorry he didnt get to visit you.
   I shall be in Moberly April 11 or 12 to Hike The Monitor Trail again
                                          Scoop

Postcard:  Postmarked: Kansas City MO 641 PM 15 Aug 1980                                                            Peery, Dave
Addressed: Jack Conroy 701 Fisk Moberly Mo. 65270            MADE BY                                           [1980]

                                                                                                  DEXTER PRESS  
                                                                                                   WEST NYACK, NEW YORK

Dear Jack & Gladys             Aug 16 '80

        Accomodations in Arkansas were a little crude but we still had a good time. 
        The Jack Conroy Reader has been a traveling companion this summer -- Excellent content! I love it.
        We saw John Crawford off to Minneapolis last weekend farewell party

                                       BREEZY MOTEL
 Our magnificently modern, mountain top motel. Featuring: air-conditioning by Nature, Bumpyrest mattresses, running water (when raining), each room with private path (to outhouse). One block from wilderness in the heart of Nature's unspoiled beauty. 24-1 DT-97248-B                 --  Scoop --
Completed

1981                                                                                                                                Peery, Dave
OSU                           The Ohio State University                                                     Fawcett Center

                                                                                                                                  for Tomorrow
                                          Sunday am.                                                                       2400 Olentangy River Road
                                          June 7                                                                               Columbus Ohio 43210
                                   on the bus between                                                                Phone 614 421-2400
                                      Columbia & K.C.                                                                           614 422-1342

Dear Jack & Gladys,

    I'm returning from a midwest Labor Press Assn. Conference in Columbus, Ohio. Stopped in St. Louis & saw Ray Adams & in Columbia. My house needs some work & I probably will sell it in Columbia.
    This has been a very busy time & I havent been to Columbia or Moberly recently. Would like to come by this summer sometime.
    No new news from Foolkiller or K. C. I missed the wedding of Dales Holland's sister. PACE is growing.
Completed

916 N. 8th St
Columbia 65270
July 15
Dear Jack,

   Verle and I enjoyed your article and review.
   Sorry I could not make it to Moberly last weekend. I left camp about 7 pm and, with incipient car trouble, I thought it best to make it back here before dark.
   I'm coming up there for the week 7/21-28 and will try to get to see you.
    Frank Headbrink underlined: almost has a job in Mt. View, Arkansas. He's down there now.
    I don't have a job yet. Teaching jobs are supposed to be plentiful but administrators still want teachers to beg for them. Hope to see you

Dave Peery
Completed

[Card]

    AND A

Jim and Jean Peueff

    Santa stopped by a few months ago with someone really out of the past -- Lou Gilbert.        

Best wishes                                                                                                    

         J.

Completed

975 Walton Ave.

The Bx., N.Y. 10452
24 Nov., 1967.
Mr. Jack Conroy
7027 South Jeffrey Blvd.
Chi., Ill. 60649
Dear M. Conroy:

   I am a doctoral candidate in History at Columbia University and am doing research on the Federal Writers' Project of the 1930s.
    My research indicates that you were on the FWP for a time. I'd like to ask you these questions:
   a) do you have a file on the FWP? (I could return it quickly, if necessary)
   b) can you suggest other people I could contact for interviews (esp. writers)? I'd like to see you when I get to Chicago this year. (If you plan on coming to N.Y. underlined: please contact me first!)
    c) Until I see you, could you tell me something of your reminiscences of that period, e. g.: your recollections of work on the FWP; of your superiors and fellow "writers"; the issue of Communist influence and
Completed

waste ("boondoggling"), and strikes on the St. Louis (I think you were there) project; how you entered--and left--the FUP; your estimation of the benefits and limitations of the writers' relief program.

   Any additional suggestions or information would be most welcome.
                              Sincerely
                                    Choate Peulcower
